content.raw:
Version 0.7.1 is a pre-release; which you should not be using. The stable version is 0.7.0, so I suspect you have the prerelease repos added. Check if you have the file `/etc/apt/sources.list.d/gazebo-prerelease.list'`. If so, remove it.  Then, run the commands below:  

```
$ sudo apt-get remove ros-melodic-ros1-ign

$ sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install ros-melodic-ros1-ign
```

After that, run these commands and post the output here:  

```
$ sudo dpkg -l | grep -i ros-ign

$ sudo dpkg -l | grep -i ros1-ign
```

The former should return nothing and the latter should now only return the 0.7.0 version.
content.html:
Version 0.7.1 is a pre-release; which you should not be using. The stable version is 0.7.0, so I suspect you have the prerelease repos added. Check if you have the file /etc/apt/sources.list.d/gazebo-prerelease.list'. If so, remove it. Then, run the commands below: 

$ sudo apt-get remove ros-melodic-ros1-ign

$ sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install ros-melodic-ros1-ign

After that, run these commands and post the output here: 

$ sudo dpkg -l | grep -i ros-ign

$ sudo dpkg -l | grep -i ros1-ign

The former should return nothing and the latter should now only return the 0.7.0 version.

content.raw:
You’re right.  I had added the prerelease repos when working on the ARIAC challenge last year.

Now I get `0.7.0` and it works correctly.  Thanks!

```
robot@washington:$ sudo dpkg -l | grep -i ros-ign
robot@washington:$ sudo dpkg -l | grep -i ros1-ign
ii  ros-melodic-ros1-ign                          0.7.0-1bionic                                                  amd64        Meta-package containing interfaces for using ROS with Ignition simulation.
ii  ros-melodic-ros1-ign-bridge                   0.7.0-1bionic                                                  amd64        Bridge communication between ROS 1 and Ignition Transport
ii  ros-melodic-ros1-ign-gazebo-demos             0.7.0-1bionic                                                  amd64        Demos using Ignition Gazebo simulation with ROS 1.
ii  ros-melodic-ros1-ign-image                    0.7.0-1bionic                                                  amd64        Image utilities for Ignition simulation with ROS 1.
ii  ros-melodic-ros1-ign-point-cloud              0.7.0-1bionic                                                  amd64        Point cloud utilities for Ignition simulation with ROS 1.
ii  ros1-ign-bridge                               0.3.0-1~bionic                                                 amd64        Bridge between Ignition messages and ROS1 messages
```

‌

content.raw: Issue is back with commit 60eb064. Will be fixed once ros-melodic-ros1-ign\* versions >= 0.7.1 are released
content.html: Issue is back with commit 60eb064. Will be fixed once ros-melodic-ros1-ign* versions >= 0.7.1 are released

content.raw:
Run the commands below:

```
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade libignition*
sudo apt-get install --reinstall ros-melodic-ros-ign  # (NOT ros1)
sudo reboot
```

‌
content.html:
Run the commands below:

sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade libignition*
sudo apt-get install --reinstall ros-melodic-ros-ign  # (NOT ros1)
sudo reboot

‌

content.raw:
Thanks, that fixes it.  I only noticed as I just set up a new machine a few hours ago.  The instructions at [#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/SystemSetupInstall](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/SystemSetupInstall) need to be updated with `ros-melodic-ros-ign`

Should I be seeing this error for the gas topic?

```
[ERROR] [1574492835.191500296]: Failed to create a bridge for topic [/model/X1/gas_detected] with ROS type [std_msgs/Bool] and Ignition Transport type [ignition.msgs.Boolean]
```

‌

content.raw: I’m glad it’s working now. With regard the gas topic, that will be fixed soon this week. Cheers!
